about.heading: Hi, I'm Ceri Morse, a full stack developer
about.subheading: I design and develop software solutions for everyone

bitesize.line1: Born and raised in Wales, the land of dragons
bitesize.line2: Fluent in both Welsh and English
bitesize.line3: Graduated from Cardiff University with a Bachelor of Science in Mathematics and its Applications degree in 2013
bitesize.line4: Transitioned from developing standalone applications to full stack web development

history.paragraph1: My interest in creating software solutions started all the way back in secondary school. I built an application for a shop system using Microsoft Access as part of a project. Seeing the interface and experience change through modifying a few lines of code was fascinating to me. I went on to study Mathematics at university but took as many Computer Science modules as possible. I built my first Java application, a hangman game, and used C++ to learn about parallel processing and image processing. I had a really exciting final year project working with the Welsh Rugby Union modelling line-out strategies using game theory, Monte Carlo simulation and Python.
history.paragraph2: Fresh from university, I started my career as a C++ developer at a gambling games company creating virtual casino games. I created a roulette game that saw a total value played increase of 700% when compared to the average game. I moved in to a lead position in a newly created online development team within the company and that’s where my interest in web development began. The more I explored the rich ecosystem of web technologies, the more I realised this was the path for me. I was offered a new role at a consultancy firm and led the development of a virtual engagement product that allowed mandatory public consultations to continue throughout the COVID-19 pandemic, culminating in an internal award for digital product of the year.

timeline.description: You'll find more information available on my timeline

techstack.description: I've used a lot of different technologies during my time as a developer. Here's what I enjoy the most and use on a day-to-day basis.

frontend.heading: Frontend
frontend.description: I take a lot of pride in creating accessible applications; the web is for everyone.

backend.heading: Backend
backend.description: I value clean and modular design with a focus on code reuse and readability.

devops.heading: DevOps
devops.description: I try to make the developer experience for deploying code as seamless as possible.

hobbies.description: Life isn’t all about work. Here are some things I like to do in my downtime to have fun and relax.

adventuring.heading: Adventuring
adventuring.description: I really enjoy going on adventures! This could be anything from hiking local routes to travelling half way around the world to explore new areas.

sport.heading: Sport
sport.description: Growing up I participated in many different individual and team sports such as karate, golf and football. These days I only really climb and play various racquet sports as a means to keep fit.

gaming.heading: Gaming
gaming.description: Ever since playing Duck Hunt on my very first console, the NES, I've enjoyed video games. I mostly play RPG games, with The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind a personal favourite of mine. Team Fortress 2 and Overwatch have been my go to FPS games.

timeline.heading: The story so far
timeline.subheading: Check out some of my significant moments
timeline.description: Here are a collection of events from my professional career. You can browse through them in their entirety, or filter them by category.

events.arupSenior: Promoted to Senior Software Developer at Arup
events.arupReactCommunity: Became a founding member of the React community within Arup
events.arupPeiLutonAirport: Used the previously created template to create another digital preliminary environmental information report website for the London Luton Airport expansion
events.arupPeiA66: Used the previously created template to create another digital preliminary environmental information report website for the A66 Northern Trans-Pennine improvements
events.arupPublicInquiryA55: Used the previously created template to create another public inquiry website for the A55 improvements that led to increased profits
events.arupVirtualEngageAward: Awarded Digital Product of the Year at the internal Digital Transformation Awards at Arup for Virtual Engage
events.arupPeiTemplate: Turned the digital preliminary environmental information report website in to a template for rapid response to client requests
events.arupPeiA417: Developed the first digital preliminary environmental information report in the UK as an accessible website for the A417 missing link scheme
events.arupTrainingAzure: Spent a week learning about the basics of Microsoft Azure
events.arupMentor: Started mentoring junior software developers within the team
events.arupVirtualEngage: Technical lead for Arup's Virtual Engage product
events.arupGitHub: Became an administrator and advocate for Arup's GitHub organisation
events.arupTrainingReact: Spent a week learning about the basics of React
events.arupPublicInquiryTemplate: Turned the public inquiry WordPress website in to a template for rapid response to client requests
events.arupPublicInquiryA40: Worked with Welsh Government to develop a WordPress website for managing the A40 improvements public local inquiry
events.arupTrainingAws: Spent a week learning about the basics of Amazon Web Services
events.arupDigitalSurgeries: Helped run digital workshops across the UK explaining the importance of digital within Arup
events.arupStart: Started a new role at Arup as a Software Developer
events.astraOnlineTrainingSofia: Spent a week in Sofia with Red Tiger Gaming understanding their online platform
events.astraOnlineTrainingGreentubeTwo: Spent a further two weeks in Vienna with Greentube on an advanced novoSDK course
events.astraOnlineGame: Developed Astra Games' first ever online game using the novoSDK
events.astraOnlineTrainingGreentubeOne: Spent three weeks in Vienna with Greentube learning about their novoSDK
events.astraOnline: Lead a newly created team at Astra Games developing content for an online platform
events.astraRouletteGame: Developed a roulette game that saw a total value played increase of 700%
events.astraMid: Promoted to Mid Level Software Engineer at Astra Games
events.astraStart: Began my working career at Astra Games as a Junior Software Engineer
events.uniGraduate: Graduated from Cardiff University with a 2:1 degree
events.uniReturn: Returned to Cardiff University to complete the final year of my degree
events.cassidianPlacement: Spent my industrial placement year at Airbus Defence and Space developing with the Unity game engine
events.uniStart: Started my Bachelor of Science in Mathematics and its Applications degree at Cardiff University

description.heading: Résumé

paragraph.line1: I wanted somewhere accessible to keep my generic résumé and what better place than on my own website! For certain applications I may tailor it to suit the role but a lot of the core information remains the same.

description.info: I want to stress that this is purely a 2 page format. It’s intended as an overview and to encourage discussions.
